title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4404.18 - Restrictions on acceptance of public assistance
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4404.18 - Restrictions on acceptance of public assistance

State Regulations

Any facility conducting off-track pari-mutuel wagering
that cashes or accepts any public assistance check or electronic benefit
transfer device issued by a public welfare official or department, or agent
thereof, as and for public assistance, as proscribed by section
151
of the

Social Services Law, shall be disciplined by the commission. Such discipline
may include one or more of the following actions: (a) revocation of a license; (b) suspension of a license; (c) a fine; or
(d) issuance of a public or private letter of
reprimand to be placed in the file of the licensee. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4404.18

Amended by

New

York State Register September 24, 2014/Volume XXXVI, Issue 38, eff. 9/24/2014. State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
